metadata.title: CVE-2013-3557 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The dissect_ber_choice function in epan/dissectors/packet-ber.c in theASN.1 BER dissector in Wireshark 1.6.x before 1.6.15 and 1.8.x before 1.8.7does not properly initialize a certain variable, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a malformedpacket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-3557` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwireshark5 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwiretap4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
libwsutil4 - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
tshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-common - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
wireshark-qt - 1.12.1+g01b65bf-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.12.1+g01b65bf-2').
